alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 11:29AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orleans, southeastern St. Tammany Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southeastern Hancock Counties through NOON CDT... At 1128 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Lake Pontchartrain near Lake Catherine, or 9 miles south of Slidell, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Waterspout coming ashore and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Waveland, Lake Catherine and Pearlington. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
